author: Matt Bassil
description:
An eBay user has put up a shadowless Charizard Pokémon card for sale for $30,000. Nothing new there, but this particular Charizard sale has one huge difference. The coveted card is still sealed within its Base set booster pack. How does the seller know it holds a Charizard, the holy grail for Pokémon collectors everywhere? They’ve had it CT scanned.

Continue reading Pokémon TCG fan says they've found a sealed Shadowless Charizard with CT scan
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards, All Pokémon sets in order
title: Pokémon TCG fan says they've found a sealed Shadowless Charizard with CT scan

author: Chloe Ward
description:
If this isn’t the droid you're looking for, why not? The Lego Star Wars Droideka model is just as dangerous and deadly as its onscreen counterpart. I mean, not literally… although have you ever stood on a piece of Lego? That’s pretty deadly. But I digress - if you're a fan of adorable rolling death machines and Lego Technic, you’ll want to add this set to your collection, especially as it’s currently 21% off over at Amazon (US only, sorry Brits!)

Continue reading This special Lego Star Wars anniversary set is going cheap right now
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Biggest LEGO sets, LEGO sets for adults, Best Star Wars LEGO sets
title: This special Lego Star Wars anniversary set is going cheap right now

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Board game publishing and distribution giant Asmodee has published its annual report for the 2024-25 financial year, the first since it left its erstwhile parent company Embracer Group, and it has turned a profit - barely. The firm’s net profit for the year was $5.46 (€4.69) million on paper, dropping to $1.33 (€1.14) million after accounting for exchange rate fluctuations with its various international subsidiaries. That’s still a lot of money - but in 2023-24 tabletop titan Games Workshop realised a $204 (£150) million profit, despite having a far lower turnover. What gives?

Continue reading Board game giant Asmodee made 100 times less profit than Games Workshop
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games , Cou
title: Board game giant Asmodee made 100 times less profit than Games Workshop

author: Matt Bassil
description:
What is the current MTG release schedule? This guide tracks all of the upcoming Magic sets in 2025 and 2026, including release dates, mechanics, and story details. From space travel to Spiderman, there’s a lot to look forward to this year. We're revisiting a fan-favorite plane, exploring a new one for the first time, and - love 'em or hate 'em - there are a lot of Universes Beyond crossovers coming out too.

Continue reading Magic: The Gathering release schedule 2025
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: Magic: The Gathering release schedule 2025

author: Matt Bassil
description:
Our interest is piqued by this upcoming DnD supplement inspired by Dune and the Ottoman Empire. Pilgrims of the Empire’s End is a setting book about a dreamlike, mystical desert world full of political intrigue and - as the name hints - surrounding a crumbling Empire.

Continue reading This Dune-inspired DnD supplement has cactus barbarians and giant crabs
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: This Dune-inspired DnD supplement has cactus barbarians and giant crabs

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The MTG card Kessig Flamebreather is spiking. This pinger from Crimson Vow is appearing in multiple decks right now, and while I’m a little untrusting of MTG Goldfish’s claim that normal copies of the card have doubled in price from $1.50 to $3 - as I’m not seeing that in the wild - we can see from sales data on TCGPlayer that the ‘Double Feature’ versions are way up in price.

Continue reading Common MTG card that's great in Pauper and EDH spikes 400%
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: Common MTG card that's great in Pauper and EDH spikes 400%

author: Timothy Linward
description:
What’s the appeal of a miniature wargame when you live in a country locked in an ongoing, all-too-real war? That’s the question that Warhammer 40k YouTube channel 52 Miniatures sets out to answer in its latest video, a documentary interviewing members of the tabletop wargaming scene in the Ukrainian town of Lviv.

Continue reading Warhammer 40k is more than a game for these fans living in a real warzone
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Warhammer 40k starter sets, Best Warhammer 40k games, All Warhammer 40k factions
title: Warhammer 40k is more than a game for these fans living in a real warzone
